'''Charles W. Moorman III''' ([[1925]] – [[3 May]] [[1996]]) was an American author and academic. He worked at the Department of English at the [[Wikipedia:University of Southern Mississippi|University of Southern Mississipi]], and wrote extensively on [[Middle English]], Medieval Literature, the Arthurian Legends, and the [[Inklings]].

==Bibliography, selected==
===Books===
*[[1960]]: ''Arthurian Triptych: Mythic Materials in Charles Williams, C.S. Lewis, and T.S. Eliot''
*[[1965]]: ''[[The Book of Kyng Arthur|The Book of Kyng Arthur: The Unity of Malory's Morte Darthur]]''

===Articles===

*[[1966]]: ''The Precincts of Felicity: The Agustinian City of the Oxford Christians''
**"The Shire, Mordor, and Minas Tirith" (pp. 86–100)
*[[1968]]: ''[[Tolkien and the Critics|Tolkien and the Critics: Essays on J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings]]''
**"The Shire, Mordor, and Minas Tirith"
